feat: add vertical slice validation guidance to /plan command (HODGE-301)

## What Changed
- Enhanced .claude/commands/plan.md (145 lines added):
  - Added "Vertical Slice Requirement" section with definition
  - Defined moderate vertical slice criteria (stakeholder value + independently testable)
  - Added good vs bad story examples (horizontal vs vertical slicing)
  - Created 4-step vertical slice decision tree for AI validation
  - Updated AI workflow with validation steps and warning mechanisms
  - Enhanced Important Notes with vertical slice requirements

- Added src/commands/plan.test.ts (45 lines):
  - Added 2 new smoke tests for template validation
  - Test verifies vertical slice guidance exists in template
  - Test verifies Important Notes section updated correctly

- Auto-updated src/lib/claude-commands.ts (169 lines):
  - Synced slash command definitions with plan.md changes

- Updated .hodge/decisions.md (114 lines):
  - Recorded 6 decisions for HODGE-301 implementation approach

## Why This Change
The /plan command was creating epics and stories without enforcing that each 
story is a vertical slice - a complete, testable, shippable unit of value. 
This led to horizontal slicing (e.g., "Backend API" + "Frontend UI") where 
stories couldn't be independently tested or shipped.

This change adds comprehensive AI guidance through template documentation to 
ensure stories provide complete value to stakeholders. Uses an AI-driven 
approach (template guidance) rather than programmatic validation, following 
the decision to trust AI to apply principles over enforcing rules.
